Database¶

DataBase¶

class hate_tweet_map.database.DataBase(file_path='', key='mongodb')¶

Class to perform operation on the mongodb collection. This class handle the operation on the collection containing tweets and the operation on the collection containing the users.

delete_more(query: dict) → int¶

Delete all the tweets that match the query given from the collection.

Parameters

query (dict) – the query to find the tweets to delete

Returns

number of tweets deleted

Return type

int

delete_one(id: str) → None¶

Delete one tweet from the collection

Parameters

id (str) – the id of tweet to delete

Returns

None

extract(query: dict) → List[dict]¶

Extract the tweets that match the query from the collection.

Parameters

query (dict) – a query to use to extract tweets from the collection

Returns

the tweets extract

Return type

List[dict]

extract_all_tweets() → List[dict]¶

Extract all the tweets in the collection sorting it by language.

Returns

the tweets extract

Return type

List[dict]

extract_all_tweets_to_feel_it() → List[dict]¶

Extract all italian tweets, already processed (by SpaCy) or not, that have not yet been analyzed by feel-it, so the tweets where the “lang” field is “it”.

Returns

the tweets extract

Return type

List[dict]

extract_all_tweets_to_geo() → List[dict]¶

Extract all tweets, already processed or not (nby SpaCy), that contain Twitter geographic information, then tweets that have a user_location field or a city and country field.

Returns

the tweets extract

Return type

List[dict]

extract_new_tweets_to_feel_it() → List[dict]¶

Extract all italian tweets, not already processed (by SpaCy), that have not yet been analyzed by feel-it, so the tweets that not contains the field “sentiment.feel-it” and where the field “processed” is False and where the “lang” field is “it”.

Returns

the tweets extract

Return type

List[dict]

extract_new_tweets_to_geo() → List[dict]¶

Extract all tweets, not already processed, that contain Twitter geographic information, then tweets not processed (by SpaCy), that have a user_location field or a city and country field, and that not have the coordinates.

Returns

the tweets extract

Return type

List[dict]

extract_new_tweets_to_nlp() → List[dict]¶

Extract all tweets, not already processed (by SpaCY).

Returns

the tweets extract

Return type

List[dict]

extract_new_tweets_to_sentit() → List[dict]¶

Extract all tweets, not already processed (by SpaCy), that have not yet been analyzed by sent-it, so the tweets that not contains the field “sentiment.sent-it” and where the field “processed” is False.

Returns

the tweets extract

Return type

List[dict]

extract_new_tweets_to_tag() → List[dict]¶

Extract all tweets, not already processed (by SpaCy), that have not yet been analyzed by TagMe, so the tweets that not contains the field “tags.tag_me” and where the field “processed” is False.

Returns

the tweets extract

Return type

List[dict]

extract_tweets_not_processed() → List[dict]¶

Extract all the tweets where tha value of the field “processed” is False. This means that this tweets have not yet been processed by SpaCy.

Returns

the tweets extract

Return type

List[dict]

get_users() → List[int]¶

For each user in tbe collection retrieves the id of the user.

Returns

a List containing the user’s id

Return type

List[int]

get_users_id() → List[int]¶

For each tweet in tbe collection retrieves the id of the user that posted the tweet.

Returns

a List containing the user’s id

Return type

List[int]

is_in(id: str) → bool¶

Check if the tweet is in the collection or not

Parameters

id (str) – the id of tweet to check

Returns

True if is in, False otherwise

Return type

bool

save_many(tweets: List) → None¶

Save more than one tweets in the collection.

Parameters

tweets (List) – the tweets to save

Returns

None

save_one(tweet: dict) → None¶

Save one tweet in the collection.

Parameters

tweet (dict) – the tweet to save

Returns

None

update_one(tweet: dict) → None¶

Update one tweet in the collection.

Parameters

tweet (dict) – the tweets to update

Returns

None
